reviews.review_msg: He sucks, thinks he is the smartest man on Earth
His lecture is interesting. He'll talk about some examples to make you understand in his lecture. You'd better have very good logical thinking in order to answer his exam questions.

I've had some bad profs, but Doug takes first prize for the worst ever. His text is a piece of garbage, covers material very fast and fails to highlight key concepts. Basically don't take any class he teaches unless you like a challenge.
Hes an awesome prof! if you have to take econ 301.. you better take it with him =)
easy, must attend lecture for his lecture notes or get it from someone else. Always stick to his notes, textbook useless
EASY, CLEAR, HELPFUL, enough said
Frequently teaches class hung over.  Hilarious!!!
No Comments
Good at thinking, just not too good at remembering.
A rookie but a funny guy

Im glad I took Econ 301 with him too. Great prof. As long as you go to the lectures/totorials and his or the TAs' office hours, you will do fine in the midterms. The final was tricky, but it was a great way distinguish students who understood the material from those who MEMORIZED the practice/problem  sets.

I am glad I took 301 with Georgi last summer. His lectures and notes were clear and useful. He cared a great deal about his students. He would extend his office hours forever until every question was answer. MTs and final were very similar to the practice questions he gave. I don't understand why so many students were complaining. If you got a bad grade, it doesn't mean he is a bad prof. It just means that your learning style needs to be changed.

really nice prof! if you visit him during his office hours, he takes the time to find out your name and everything. it's his first time teaching, so he's not great, but he's the kind of guy who would care enough to improve. i definitely hope to see him around in years to come. go georgi!

He cares about his students. I personally thought his lectures were pretty clear. I was able to understand the material from his lecture notes. It is a must that you spend time reviewing the Problem Sets as they are very similar to the Midterm and Final problems. The final was hella hard. Watch out because easy midterms can mean hard finals.

He is a nice person, but he doesn't have the teaching ability at all!!! He makes too many mistakes all the time. His office hours are useless becuz there is always a huge a line up and even if you get a chance to ask questions, he can't explain clearly. I feel like wasting my tuition on him even though I aced all exams. I didn't learn anything :(

His is a nice prof. His lecture notes is really helpful. If you do all his problem sets,you'll get a good mark in MTs. The final was hard n tricky, but overall was easy. His 301 is much easier than any other prof. Highly recommended to take his class.

Course material a bit too easy and going over them  a bit slowly compared with Bus 207 I took 4 years ago with Matadeen. Notes are ok but its better to have some more quantitative examples. Exams are not too fair as they are too similar to practice questions/problem sets rather than testing students' true understanding of the material...
He was fair on all exams and it was his first time teaching.  I think everyone should cut him some slack; he was really passionate for what he does.

I dont understand y many people said his teaching is good. He is the worst prof i ever had (not himself,just the teaching style). His notes is so confusing, with many useless info but lacking of key explaination. Most time its like he is talking to himself rather than communicating with students.

Intense calculations, but exam format follows strictly with problem sets so you will be fine just by repeating practicing. If the exam tells you to explain using words, USE HIS WORDS. You can get his intepretation off problem sets. Overall he is a good prof and the class avg is high

He really cares his students,especially about those Math stuff. However, it is your responsiblity to preview the text which helps you to detect those mistakes he made on lectures. Most of my friends told me that this course is super hard,but He made it fair to us, at least for Midterm,maybe final will be hard,otherwise 50%over will get A...

I think Georgi is a very good prof. He really understood students struggled with the Math and spent an entire week explaining the Lagrangians in lecture. I agree his exams have the same format but he always puts enough tricks to make sure you understood and  not just memorized his practice exam and problem sets. I learnt a lot in his class.

Midterms are almost identical to the practice midterms. However this guy can't really teach. It seems like he is never prepared for lectures and constantly makes mistakes in the lecture notes. The lecture basically lays down the theory and you learn how to do the calculations in tutorials. It would be helpful if he did more calculations in class

This is my first time taking this class and I think Georgi is a great prof. His practice exams are very similar to the actual ones so if you do the practice ones, you should get a decent mark on the exams. If you stay on top of your work, it's actually not that bad of a class. I find his notes are very helpful as well.

Georgi is not a bad prof. What makes him bad is the fact he constantly makes mistakes in his notes (sometimes im even unsure whether or not what we are learning from his notes are entirely correct). 2nd there are no detailed examples given, so you will struggle with whether u did the math correct or not. MT are always hard. (1st time taking it)

The problem isn't Georgi, the problem is the class itself. ECON 301 is super difficult. Georgi does an excellent job teaching it, especially when compared to Barkin or Lufle. Georgi actually cares about the students and is extremely helpful. As someone who has failed ECON 301 before, believe me when I say Georgi is the best prof for ECON 301.

The worst prof I ever had.  Lecture notes r terrible,even the answer he put online r impossible to read through. He didn't have a organized schedure, so everything is such a mess. I just feel like wasting money entirely....... it's so confusing to listen to him, so tired to copy his notes and so disapponted to see his answers on webct.  Strongly recommand not taking his course

The worst experience I've had at SFU.  She is definetely not clear.  Not helpful at all (very vague when you ask her questions and has low enthusiasm to help).  The course is not easy, and having a prof like her makes it worse.

She has a heavy accent, making it a little hard to understand what she is saying. Make sure you go to tutorials if you want to pass the course, because they somewhat help with preparing for her very hard midterms and final. Thank goodness this course is scaled, because the average for the midterms and finals were all below 60%.

Don't trust these comments below. She is incomprehensible and I can guarantee that more than 90% of the class didn't understand her. Even exams are not understandable let alone lectures. Final was brutal. Just survived the course because of scaling. Got B+. Do not take it with her unless u love stressing out the whole semester.
she is a very nice prof. if you have question, just ask her or the ta's they're really helpful. like the previous comment said, shes one of the best profs for 301 despite her accent.
She is soooooo nice!! My grade is unexpected! Good prof! Take 301 with her!!Two TAs are good,too. Clear explaination.Yin is perfect!
Very young prof with accent. Might be hard to understand to some people. Attend all lectures and take notes then you will be fine
smart man. good at Math. very helpful if you ask questions. Needs to go to class cuz he has lots notes to write down!

Great prof. He knows his stuff. Math intensive. If you suck at math or are not very good at it, you will most likely not do well in his class. Marks were fair and do yourself a favour and DON'T fall behind in the readings etc. Attend all lectures+tutorials as they help you tremendously. Prof has a thick accent so he could be hard to understand.
It was a super boring class. The material was dull. But attendance is highly recommended since the notes are not posted and everything is from the notes. Exams were hard and confusing.

Ben is a great guy.  He is very strong in math and therefore teaches you a lot of it.  I remember taking notes of these endless formulas that made me want to shoot my self in the brain, but when I asked him he explained the stuff with with ease.  He is very helpful and is very encouraging if you show any interest at all. Don't avoid him!

This PROF, EWW, he talks a whole semester about Cobb Douglas and emphasize Cobb Douglas on his notes. In the EXAM, guess what? NO Cobb Douglas! He put this retarded Log in the exam to trick his students. AVOID HIM! His exam is hard, because he doesn't go over it in his notes

he is difficult to understand in lecture, but helpful in person.both exams are hard, midterm average is 50/100,you can weight everything on final.However,I suggest you not.The final is worst. his teaching is very boring, rush,lots of notes.his notes are all out of the text.the workbook is actually useful for exams.
No Comments

There is a reason why the econ department made this a requirement for the major. A lot can be said about McGee's teaching,but if you studied consistenly you will be fine. Also, work smart, not hard. Use his PPT slides, they have all information in them! And if you think this course is hard, wait for comes as you go further in the major ;)

the final grade exam is 40%...even thought hes gonna scale or what so ever, the avg is still 40%.....the MT was ok but the final was brutal..absolutely helpless to practice hwk questions bcuz on the final exams none of those questions (or anything similar)will be asked. Just purely memorize every slide will get u 50% bcuz half of exam is definition

His ppt slides are very confusing and almost impossible to understand. Lectures werent that helpful either. Exams and quizzes ar eextremely hard and frustrating. If u are already enrolled in his class.... Well... Good luck
hard final, testing material which is not on syllabus and exercises without answer! Do not take his cource which you will never get a reasonable grade!

The course is hard, and this professor makes the course materials hard and deep as well. His concepts and calculations are very complicated and final is extremely hard and much harder than sample final. That is why the average on final is 14/40.Take 301 with Andrew, maybe it is a good preparation for Econ 302 and other upper Econ upper courses.

The course was difficult, that's for sure. If you, "Did all the problem sets," it doesn't mean that you knew the concepts, it means you could solve particular questions using some concepts. Everything else was in the lecture notes for both the midterm and final. You can't study last minute for such a hard course. Andrew had fair exams.

The exam was very hard compared to his sample final that he gave us from 2 semesters ago. Decent teaching, but the final topic was not taught very well. The final exam had a question that was on this topic which was a decent proportion of the grade.

There are two types of students that post on RateMyProf. Those who do well and those who don't. Obviously the posts below are people who didn't do well and are complaining. Andrew is a decent professor, kind guy who responds to problems that students have. The final was tough yes, but if you had actually done the problem sets you would have passed

Class average in the final was 13.9 out of 40. There comes a point where he needs to adjust the course so students can do well based on the effort they give.  I know it'll be scaled but 13.9 out of 40 in a final is just mind boggling. Although you'll learn a lot, Mcgee is one of the hardest ECON teachers here in SFU. Try to find a different prof.

I was standing at a B+ before the final, now i'm not so confident.  My final grade is significantly much lower, frankly this course is just plain hard.  There was no coincidence that no one left at 3 hours.  The practice final was relatively fair and moderate, but what he gave us in the final was just outrageous.  I suggest you to avoid this guy.

Hardest econ 301 teacher to date.  Do not take him, this man clearly does not mark fair.  I understand that finals are suppose to be hard, but when the TA's got only up to chapter 11 and could only answer 1-3 questions you know you're in trouble.

Terrible professor.  In my 3 years of economic study I have not encountered such an unfair professor!  I usually average an B+ to A- in other economic courses but  Andrew's tests are just unfair!  He added additional chapters not included in the syllabus. Ta's were useless.  Answers to problem sets were only posted a week prior to exam. Do not take

Midterm was hard, the final even harder.  Hard to study for this course since prof does not post answers.  Tas are utterly useless at covering the problem sets.  Marking for this course was definately unfair.  Do not take mcgee.

Final was hell and I mean hell.  Not only did he test us an CH 13, a topic that he went over briefly a week prior to the test, it was a large part of the 40 marks that he put.  CHAPTER 13 wasn't even in the SYLLABUS!!!  Considering the TA's only got through chapter 11 and REFUSE to post ch 12,13,14.  We had to teach outselves economics.  AVOID!

Final is like a hell. He added additional chapter which was not included in the course outline and he did not explain it well. Moreover, it was a big part of the final. TAs are helpless. They are able to explain you only 1 problem out of 6...the worse experience in Econ I have ever had. 1/3 class failed...unbelievable...
I gave the wrong rating... He is far from average... He is excellent... He is definitely the best choice for 301!
An extremely passionate professor. Always there to help the students. I wish there's more time to learn from him. Hey, what's not to love?

I don't understand how his ratings could fall; because the MT average was 35%? It should not matter because grades will be curved anyways. Although his handwritings are not clear sometimes, his points are very straightforward and cohesive. TAs were extremely helpless though. DO WORKOUTS before tutorials so you know what you should ask before hand.
the course should be a easy one but he made it so hard be careful to choose any course from him, he always want to teach you everything but is that possible just for one semester and one course ????
Watch the rating fall after this semester.. ;)
He is a nice professor what he teaches you show up in the exams.He is very helpful. You study his notes and homework and your grade will be in the A range. Highly recommended.
It is one of the easiest econ 301 profs. You must go to the lecture in order to get a good grade. Good notes, easy midterm, moderate final. Highly recommended.

Makes mistakes here and there in lecture but it's acceptable given that he hasn't been teaching for long. His notes are sometimes unclear because of his writing, but for the most part they're good. Exams and quizzes are extremely easy.

great guy, and excellent class. this has got to be one of the best courses i have taken at SFU, and he does a great job teaching it. the stuff you learn is actually useful, especially if you are actually interested in business, mainly finance, and economics. Definitely recommend
Who is David Cox? He is the best professor in the dept. of economics. But he never smiles after the lecture.
This guy is a legend! Unbelievable teaching skill! His notes are so clear. Just read them, U will get at least a B. I would definitely love to take classes under him again.
not much math stuff involved so this makes 301 a really easy course!! also ...no need to read the text for exams...n the exams were not that hard!
Fair Midterm, but very hard final. Overall, it still worth to take it
I was warned about Econ 301, but I was surprised at how easy this guy taught it. So easy, it seemed to be a repeat of an Econ 100 level course.
Any shmoe could teach this class.  He did a decent enough job doing it. He wasn't easy, he wasn't hard.  Take his class, get a B, and move on to more interesting courses.
Hard but fair exams. don't understand why others are saying he is easy compare to other profs. did horribly....
yawn
No Comments
Very Helpful and friendly. His exams are Tough, but Fair. Need to improve his  horrible hand writing. Lecture is kinda dull, but the pace picked up later in the course.

He is one of the best professor in SFU. although second mid-term is pretty hard, but the first mid-term and the final although not very easy, but at least, not hard. I think it's becasue this is a hard course. As i heard, other professor had made them even more harder.
I guess he read too much of "too easy, too easy,..." here. Because now, he gave a very hard midterm. The 1st got avg of 71 but the 2nd got 59.Better watch out and find other ECON 301 prof.
Too easy!  It is like he is asking us to give him easy rating back!
He is really nice guy!!!! lectures were bit boring but informative. I think he is better than any other Econ 301 instructors.
Excellent at explaining the material, however the lectures are extremely dry. Don't take a night class with him.
Exams are challenging.  Needs to work on his lecture! Pretty boring! I recommend to not take him.
WORST LECTURER!

Took his course in the U of Chicago.  This russian guy has absolutely no knowledge of the intermed. econ.  The textbook is brutally error-proned! Avoid! Take J. Amegashie in Econ301 if you want good grade and lecture!
Pretty good prof.  Alot of people said the second midterm was hard, but I thought it was really easy.
Class avg 78% for MT1, so anyone below 70% will get D or F.  Not giving student chances to catch up the marks.But remember, that's a 5 credits core courses, so if u fail, u'll be in big trouble.
Adds spice to an otherwise dry lecture material. First year teaching, and I quite enjoy the pace and clarity of the chalkboard rather then overheads or pre-printed notes.
Materials were dry, and he tried his best to explain the concepts, without much success. After all it is his first year teaching. Uses only the chalk so the pace of lecture is extremely slow.
lectures are pretty clear, probably one of the better profs for 301 but exams are tough...pretty tough course over all...he's a lazy guy too but not gonna complain...we get long breaks
No Comments
No Comments
angry at people who are late, he's always sick AND late = a big hypocrite. He has issues and have something against university students.
short temper, skips or is late for class often, do not take his class
always skip class and said he is sick, nothing more than lazy and hard exam
If you don't have old exams, don't take the course
Laziest instruct.  Anyone with old exams will get an A since he reuses 100%.
Nice prof. Know his stuff well and give time for you to think through the content in class. I like his scale system.

Fill in the blanks online notes and covers mostly the same thing as the textbook! His lectures are very slow and clear, in fact the speed at which he was moving was boring me to tears!. I believe this is why students do poorly, the way he teaches it is very dry. He had to scale up both midterms and the final exam even though the material was easy!
easy and clear prof.  fair tests & easy final.  take this prof!!!!
everything in the lecture is rite out of the book, no extra info

hardd class! just got my first midterm back and the average mark is 40%!! hard exam but he added marks to everyones exam to bring up the average.. hopefully next exam will be easier.. the best thing to do to prepare for the exams is go over tutorial questions and do practise questions at the end of the chapter..
No Comments
Erik is awesome. Comments above are not very accurate. Econ301 or 201 is not an easy course. You don't expect to get a fairly good grade unless you really try your best.

His class is just HARD, especially for those people who are not good at math.  Econ 301 is purelly a math class.  Random in class quiz is stupid and his lecture seems easy but exam is very tricky.  Beware about him

Okay Teacher, midterms are fair hard final! He expects you to do difficult calculations without a calculator and doesn't give us enough time for all the exams. He is very strict on marking and will not allow shifting weight of the final or midterms under no circumstances.  Never willing to stay after class to answer additional questions

He is a very knowledge teacher. But you can see from the exams, he has no idea how to teach. We do not allow to bring calculator to the exams, and one single easy question about S=D he gave us a number like 114... Does he want to test our counting skill?
Didn't do to well in his final.  Anyone know what the average was?  I think he is a decent prof but that final was to hard.

She is a very good person who always willing to help her students. But her teaching skill is bad enough to make you confuse about this course. Take her class if and only if you are super good at math. Her major was computer programming, so you always have to follow the logical thinking. Worst text book used I have ever seen.
VERY GOOD PROFESSOR, IF YOU PRACTISE CAREFULLY, THE EXAM IS SO EASY~
A fairly good prof. Dont know why a lot of people give negative feedback on her. Those who fails her class must not have studied at all. Her exams are super easy
Good prof. Very fair exams and clear interpretation and helpful. Someone who fails her class must have not studied hard. Her exam is much less challenging compared to other profs.

"The overall performance was very good. The class average is C+ and I am very happy to find out that compared to other years, the proportion of students who ended up with C- or higher is a lot higher with your class." That's all u can get from her. Read all the comments first before u take her class.

One of the worst profs in Econ department and that says a lot since most of them are not competent. She's terrible at explaining stuff and makes lots of mistakes. Also she comes across as a very rude person even though she probably didn't mean to.

Horrible Prof. Her notes are unrelated to what is being tested on and is very vague and confusing. Continues to teach on even when the class seems oblivious to what she's teaching. It also seems she has no clue what she's teaching as she constantly makes mistakes and seems to be reading off a paper while lecturing. Horrible prof. Do not take...
Likeable person, really cares about students, but not the right prof or text for 301.
Good prof. Like any other 'weeder' course, if you don't pre-read and don't do the problem sets, you will bomb. If you do put in the effort, you'll do well. I give her a B+

Very Poor at conveying material in class, and even explaining concepts in office hours. Does theory in class, and numerical problems in exams. go figure. Exams are too long for the time she allots, 1 person did not leave her midterms in a 230 person class, not responsive to student feedback
Go to her office hours, and ask for help. I had 105, 290,301. she is awesome, but you must attend her classes and try to do assignments. I give her A+
Good prof. Passionate about teaching. A bit rushed but covered a lot of ground. The letdown for me was the text, not the prof. Wish the Nicholson text (Summer 2010) had been used.

Gulriz is very likeable as a person and clearly means well, however, she simply lacks the skills to teach a class at this level. It's unfortunate that she could not convey the material in a comprehensive manner because now I feel like I will struggle in future Economics classes because I didn't learn enough. Avoid her!!

Gulriz is a very nice person, BUT she does not know how to teach. She is very unclear, and explains the material so fast that no one understands what is going on. She teaches theory in class, but her midterms are based on Math problems.The only way to study for this course is thorough reading the book and getting LOTS of help form TAs.

Both of her midterms were relevant to tutorial questions and the study guide. Since she does not examine hard stuffs, I'm afraid I might not do well in Econ302.. btw those who complained she cannot teach, I agree with you. Those who complained her exams are impossible, you have problems, not her.

I can not be angry with her for lacking the skills to teach. Therefore I am upset at SFU for hiring her, and for making her teach Econ 301, arguably one of the most important econ classes of our undergrad career. I have no idea how she was given clearance to teach this class, as she lacks the skills to teach at this level.

Avoid Gulriz at all costs. Without a doubt she is THE WORST professor I have had at SFU. She just plain does not know how to teach. I think she needs to take a few classes herself and learn that skill. I am scared that even if I pass this class, I won't know the material well enough for future classes. Please heed my warning!

One of the worst profs I've had in SFU.  The accent I can understand and take but her notes and delivery is just plain horrible.  I have no doubt she knows her stuff but she doubts herself when delivering it.  It also doesn't help that all her notes are based on the old textbook because the new and old textbooks are worlds different

Terrible Prof. Would AVOID at ALL COST. MT was super unfair. did not give enough time at all and class average was around 40%. instead of scaling it shes weighing the final to 75% . She cannot teach in lecture. Terrible attitude. She gets angry when a student ask questions
shes the worst prof ever, can't teach, bad writing, yells in class! just horrible

Just awful. This class was a complete disaster. I hate to be mean, but this lady should not be a teacher. She may be smart but she can't teach at all. That stupid Russian student who wouldn't stop arguing with her the whole semester didn't help either. SFU econ should absolutely get rid of her. useless. dont take a class with her if you can avoid.

Class ended up with students on two extremes, ended up with lots of A/A+. She does get confused over her own notes sometimes, but not too bad. She could use some improvement in intonation when teaching. Tests are straight out of tutorial hw and notes, very fair. If you read the chapters taught you should have no problem.

Although she is a knowledgable professor, I found her material to be purely based on her assignments and past midterms. If you manage to learn from my mistakes you can definitely achieve a B or higher. Doing this can be pivotal and can make a difference between a C and a B. Good luck

Course material is hard, but she did a good job teaching. She took time to reiterate points and made sure we understood. Exams were tough, but she bumped everyone's marks up. Keep up in lectures and do the tutorial questions and you'll be fine. Went into the final with 113% overall (because of her extra marks) and came out with an A+.

I don't want to rate her badly, but i really upset,took her class twice and still can't keep up with what she expects from student, i'm okay with pure teaching as far as the exam is fair but her lecture is really unclear, that's the thing that i hate from her, if you want to take with her, please think twice, i think i made a wrong decision here...

WORST econ prof. I HATE econ now because of her. Notes are NOT notes more like sentences. Writing AND GRAPHS are messy. Talks AND writes TOO FAST which causes everyone to focus on copying down her notes rather than to what she is saying. Because if you don't she will either 1) write off screen or 2)move everything that she just wrote off screen.

She didn't know what she was teaching and didn't know what students were asking. She tended to make simple things complicated. She rushed thru the last couple chapters but in the final, she asked questions deeply about those chapters. She spoke in a hypnotic, monotonic way.

She tends to get lost in her lectures , true. But she is actually quiet fair when it comes to exams, questions are EXACTLY like tutorial and sample  exam questions only number change. She puts up the solutions too. I took 290 with her and taking 301 with her , by choice as well, so she is doing something right.

She's OFTEN confused with her own teaching material in both tutorial and lecture. So, students have to help her find her way back sometimes. She can't get her points across at all. She TALKS&WRITES a lot like CRAZY, but you can never really tell what she's exactly trying to tell you. I don't think she understood the material herself.
terrible teacher :(. take this class if you want to fail.
She is the worst teacher in SFU .lecture useless!! Confusing problem,totally no idea what she talking about!!AVOID HER!!
Monotone, confusing lecture on easy material, better off reading the book yourself than going to her lecture

100% agree with the other posting. Terrible teacher. I'm in my 4th year and she is easily the worst teacher I've had. Poor communication skills, apparent lack of understanding of the topic, and seems completely clueless to students needs. Makes what should be a fairly simple class just confusing and completely un-enjoyable. Avoid.
The best 302 prof. After the score is given, he is willing to help you change the score if your answer is really reasonable but the TA criticizes it wrong.
Never take a course with him, he is HEARTLESS. He doesn't know how to teach and he doesn't care for his students. What a horrible person he is.
Avoid him. He juz doesnt seem to be teaching but reading off the slides. He is the worst econ prof.

Accent is negligible,but you know he doesn't care what you're learning.  He appears to be in front of the class for the purpose of proving his own intelligence.  He wrote a really difficult final with a major time constraint and told us he thought it was easy and that we would find the exam "really quite cute".  It felt like he wanted us to fail!
hard hard hard...thatz all I can say

assignments are hard, doesnt go over enough in class for us to do them well, spends very little time doing the math in lec, speeds through power point he didnt even make, very lazy, doesnt give any breaks, and markes hw weird, you get either 0%, 25%, 75%, or 100%...and omg he has the weirdest voice!!!

He yells A LOT out of frustration, the problem is he doesn't seem to understand how to listen as to what you're confused about. His midterms are fair, but his final is BRUTAL. I left with a headache and saw ppl crying. WOW. Enough said.
Very good professor that wants you to do well but still makes you work for it
I admit that you need to work really hard to succeed in his class, but he is overall a fair person and i found him really nice

I have a 3.3 GPA and got a C minus in this course. Final was very long and difficult. Few ppl finished early.  Don't take this class with him. Saw him during office hours and found he gets frustrated with students.  He just writes notes but doesn't teach them well.

Cristoph's exams are so unbelievably difficult considering he does not go over HOW to do the problems in class, simply the theory behind it. On the final, there were multiple questions we had never even seen before and it was far too long for the allotted time. He seems to think that a 40% midterm average is acceptable. Avoid him at all costs.
His final is EXTREMELY hard! midterms are okay...pretty similar to assignments/old midterms...
very very hard final!be careful!

Not good.  Handwriting is too hard to read.  Not good at explaining things.  Gives you questions on the midterm and final that are way harder than anything you learned in class.  TA's not good either.  Only take him if you have no choice.
Overall fair prof. His hand writing sometimes hard to read and not much practice problems in tutorials but you are set if you do the sample midterms and final

The ratings here do not do Christoph justice. I took this class with him last semesterm, and I found his teaching great. He writes his notes during class, so it's easy to follow along; encourages questions; and the exams are based on practice midterms. However, a word of caution: there aren't a lot of practice problems for tutorials.

The exams are relatively easy (b/c he gives practice midterms which r similar) but the TA marking was BRUTAL. I stopped attending tutorials b/c TA was horrible at teaching. 1) Go to lectures, take NEAT notes. 2) Clarify notes w/ textbook 3) Do practice exams + assignments and understand how to do them and u're set.

Great Prof. He really hits the point in lecture. I'm not suprized at 1/3 of the class failing because they don't attend lecture or attend tutorials. His exams are almost identical to his practice questions and old exams. Can't expect to pass if you don't plan on putting in the work.

Christoph is a solid professor.  Go to every lecture and pay attention.  His exams are based from his lectures, which is closely related to the text. 2-25% midterm, 50% final.  He gives out practice questions 2 weeks before the exam.  Study them!!!
He does not like to help students nor he does not like them to do well. one third of the class failed, and he tries to show that econ is hard.

Christoph's lecture notes and practice assignments are very helpful for studying for exams. The textbook isn't really necessary. Sometimes he can move too fast. Make sure you go to lecture though. I got an A the second time I took this class, up from a D when I first took it with Christoph. The difference was going to class the second time around.

I think he is not bad. Comparing with another lady in summer09. He is relatively better than her. He didn't teach the general equilibrium on ch.30 and he didn't expect you to calculate the long run cost function which both could drive students crazy. Overall, he is not bad.

I think he is not bad. Comparing with another lady in summer09. He is relatively better than her. He didn't teach the general equilibrium on ch.30 and he didn't expect you to calculate the long run cost function which both could drive students crazy. Overall, he is not bad.
Brutal!! no chance on learning the material and doing well with this guy. Also, needs to find some new TAs! The "T" is meant to stand for teaching, not terrible!!
this guys is ridiculous! there is no way he can be a professor! avoid him at all cost!!!! one third of the class did not pass this course, what do u think?
i think his exams are fair, very very similar to the practice homework. Just work on the exercise and you'll do fine
36% of ppl got "F" after final
Should review calculus material. Try to help students but not the best at explaining things. Assignments too easy & exams wayy too hard!!
his hangdwriting really hard to understand and TA also so bad .. always make mistakes on writing and this is the hardest course I felt so terrible.

This is definitely a course worth taking with this prof. The class was rigorous but the prof made it easy by requiring only very few simple Math methods. Most of the problems on the exams were really straight-forward and the short-answer questions required only basic understanding of the notes. By far, an easy class. You learn a lot with this prof.
I always keep my opinions about profs to myself but, christoph is the reason i came to this website. By far the hardest Prof i have ever encountered.

unclear both verbal and handwriting. He teaches all theory and notation with no examples; Thus making his assignments and exams beyond hard. He also makes a lot of mistakes in his notes and rushes through them.

i am honestly tired of these kinds of profs that sfu keeps hiring. do they only hire hard/unclear profs??? this prof is the sole reason that i will not be majoring in econ. he completely discouraged me from ever concentrating in economics.
Do not take him if u have a chance

I have never felt so lost in a class as I do in his 301 class. He speeds through the course with no concern of whether or not the students are learning the material. Probably a nice guy, but definately a bad teacher!!
the worst of the worst. class is extremely boring with a heavy accent. Not helpful in person either.

Liu is a GOOD teacher. He comes to class and lectures with his well almost perfect notes and answers your questions somewhat well but go to him one on one and he will answer much better.  You need to just go to class and your grade will improve by a letter grade atleast. Liu is also very funny!!!

I have took 2 classes of him...he rocks!!!  well-organized and the mid-term and finalz are fair!!! no need to read the textbook coz his lecture notes is already clear enough!!  He is the best prof that i ever had!!!!!
Junjie is the BEST PROF EVER!!!
Junjie is by far the best prof at SFU. Very helpful and knowledgeable. I wish I have each and every class with him, he rocks. Gives the best notes and he is very friendly guy. You da man, Junjie.

He is the best professor at SFU!!  His notes are clear and easy to follow.  His lectures are interesting and informative.  Plus he is also very very good at explaining.  Junjie should definitely teach more courses at SFU!  This will make our lives much easier ^^
Pretty clear notes.  Mainly study for his notes and you will be fine.  However his theory on his exams are super hard.  You have really need to know ins and outs for the therory.

Notes are everything. Study the notes and you should be fine. Not too much math, mostly theory form notes (75%theory, 25%math).  Hard to understand sometimes during lecture. Didn't find him very helpful during office hours.
good prof, bad english, note: Lecture NOTES are everything, 2/3 on theories, 1/3 math,

Screw the Textbook! The textbook will confuse you, only focus on his notes. Liu is better than the other two 301 profs (Martin & Tchkinov), at least Liu won't treat this as a math class, he focus less on calculus and a lot more on theories. Liu's exams are also the most unexpected out of my 3 yrs in SFU. Liu's "B" range and "C" range is very large.

Avg for MTs are 61-64%, grades on curve. Junjie, good prof, but hard to understand w/ his accent. TA YiLin was sort of BETTER. Material is NO DOUBT HARD. Junjie, not a big calculus person, there was still calculations, but NO TRICKY calculas, THANK GOD. Knows his stuff very well.

A really nice prof with a thorough understanding of the course, but his exams were tough!  His final tested much more theory than his calculations-based midterms. If you ever go and see him during office hours, he is always happy to help. Do not skip his lectures, you need his notes!
His notes are very clear and detailed. Midterms were fair but final exam was tough. Over 80% the final exam was on lump-sum and per-unit stuff. So memorize it.

hard...tough, I am still in this class, the mids are hard, but never know why the class avg are still so high for 2 mids. the mids are tricky, past mids and final are useless, Jliu will just change very much for every possible questions. So dun trying to memorize his format of testing you guys! That's all!!! good luck
Let's just say he sux at teaching.
Lack of english skill. U better be good at math if u want to pass his exam .. u'll know what i mean~

VERY unorganized notes, lack of english skills hindered his ability to communicate material to students, made material more difficult than it actually is, tough exams, an average of 45% on the final should reflect his teaching ability
Very messy notes.  Sometimes, don't know where is where.  Hard to understand what he said on the class.
O.K communication. doesn't use a lot of application examples in his notes. hard to understand, hard midterm and final. Uses examples from text (tutorial). overall pretty diffcult course.
awsome prof, the best
learned lots and lots  take him only if you wish to undertand real life
She doesn't know how to teach. She makes a big mistake on assignments, exams and sample exams... She doesn't care about students. Do not take her courses.

Her explanation in lecture was just fine. She needed to slow down and explain things for the more difficult concept but overall her explanations made sense and were clear. She is also really eager to be helpful during office hour so go. Theres alot of calculus in this course (which is expected).

You can tell Leanna is interested in this field but she does a terrible job of teaching.  Her nervousness keeps her from explain concepts well.  Seems like she is scatterbrained about certain topics and gets a lot of examples she does in class incorrect.  I needed to take this course, but wish it had been with another teacher. A lot of calculus.
difficult class, but she unorganized, unclear in her exam and assignments questions, doesn't want to clarify, textbook is a better teacher, dont go to class read the textbook.
